TableColumnsTooltips.EventDate: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.HistoryEventDate: Date and time of the history event.
TableColumnsTooltips.DCS:
Data Coding Scheme. Possible values are:
  • 0: SMSC Default Alphabet,
  • 1: IA5 (CCITT T.50)/ASCII (ANSI X3.4),
  • 2: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary),
  • 3: Latin 1 (ISO-8859-1),
  • 4: Octet unspecified (8-bit binary),
  • 5: JIS (X 0208-1990),
  • 6: Cyrllic (ISO-8859-5),
  • 7: Latin/Hebrew (ISO-8859-8),
  • 8: UCS2 (ISO/IEC-10646),
  • 9: Pictogram Encoding,
  • 10: ISO-2022-JP (Music Codes),
  • 11: Reserved,
  • 12: Reserved,
  • 13: Extended Kanji JIS(X 0212-1990),
  • 14: KS C 5601,
  • 15: Reserved.
TableColumnsTooltips.Reason: Error Code. 0 if Trx Result is Success and appropriate error code otherwise. Error Code shall be interpreted within specified Error Context. Same Error Code value may have different meanings in different contexts.

TableColumnsTooltips.Date: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.OrigTypeOfNumber:
Sender (Originator) Type of Number.
  • 0: Unknown
  • 1: International
  • 2: National
  • 3: Network Specific
  • 4: Subscriber Number
  • 5: Alphanumeric
  • 6: Abbreviated
TableColumnsTooltips.TrafficType:
Type of the traffic.
  • 11: MO
  • 12: MO Inbound
  • 13: MO Outbound
  • 21: MT
  • 22: MT Alphanumeric
  • 23: MT Shortcode
  • 24: MT Intl to Inbound
  • 31: SRI
TableColumnsTooltips.OPResult:
Result of the operation.
  • 0: No Error
  • 1: Error
TableColumnsTooltips.OPErrorCode: Error code of operation (MAP Error Code).
TableColumnsTooltips.OPRejectMethod:
Reject Method.
  • 1: Silent Discard
  • 2: Reject with Error
TableColumnsTooltips.ConcatInfo: Concat SMS part no, 1 <= part no <= total part count / Concat SMS total part count [Concat SMS correlator is used correlate parts of a concatenated SMS, value is same for all parts]

TableColumnsTooltips.EventDate: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.HistoryEventDate: Date and time of the history event.
TableColumnsTooltips.Reason: Error Code. 0 if Trx Result is Success and appropriate error code otherwise. Error Code shall be interpreted within specified Error Context. Same Error Code value may have different meanings in different contexts.

MessageContent.Name: Content ID

TableColumnsTooltips.Time: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.PointType: Operation Result, either Success or Failure.
TableColumnsTooltips.Result: Operation Error Code. 0 if Operation Result is Success, appropriate error code otherwise.
TableColumnsTooltips.Input: Subscriber's USSD input string received from mobile device.
TableColumnsTooltips.Language: Subscriber's language: EN: English, AR: Arabic.

TableColumnsTooltips.Time: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.SessionId: Unique Id of the Collect Call request. All events of a specific Collect Call request will have the same Id for filtering out the events related to that request.
TableColumnsTooltips.ChargedCallDuration: Call duration for the connected Collect Call request.

TableColumnsTooltips.Time: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrRedirectionNum: Redirecting Party MSISDN who forwarded incoming calls to the Service (Called Party is same with the Redirecting Party for normal / not forwarded calls).
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrOriginatingAddressPresentation:
Calling Line Identification Restriction (CLIR) Status. Possible values are:
  • Normal: Not Restricted
  • Private: Restricted
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrRedirectionReason:
Reason for redirection to the Service. Possible reasons are:
  • Unreachable: Called Party is not reachable, phone switched-off, out-of-coverage.
  • Busy: Called Party is busy.
  • Not Answered: Called Party did not answer the call.
  • Unconditional: Called Party unconditionally forwarded all calls to the Service.
  • Undefined: Reason undefined or not specified.
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrSMSTicket: Ticket received from SMSC for the submitted SMS. Used to correlate submitted MT SMS and its Delivery Report.
TableColumnsTooltips.EdrSMStatus:
Final delivery status of the Missed Call Alert SMS. Possible delivery status values are:
  • 100: DELIVERED
  • 200: WILL_BE_RETRIED
  • 300: FAILED
  • 600: ENROUTE
  • 700: EXPIRED
  • 500: DELETED
  • 400: UNKNOWN

TableColumnsTooltips.Time: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.SessionId: Unique Id of the Poke Call request. All events of a specific Poke Call request will have the same Id for filtering out the events related to that request.

VM.BasicOfferDescription: This is the basic offer which is free.

History.PageHeader: Voice Mail History [Calling Party = {{origparty}}; Called Party = {{destparty}}]

TableColumnsTooltips.HistoryEventDate: Date and time of the history event.

Details.PageHeader: Voice Mail Details [Calling Party = {{origparty}}; Called Party = {{destparty}}]

History.PageHeader: Ring Back Tone History [Calling Party = {{originatingParty}}; Called Party = {{destinationParty}}]

TableColumnsTooltips.HistoryEventDate: Date and time of the history event.
TableColumnsTooltips.SessionId: Unique ID of the Ring Back Tone request. All events of a specific Ring Back Tone request will have the same ID for filtering out the events related to that request.

TableColumnsTooltips.Date: Date and time of the subscription event.
TableColumnsTooltips.TransactionId: Unique ID generated for each subscription related transaction. Transaction ID shall be used for problem diagnosis within product traces and logs.
TableColumnsTooltips.EventType: Subscription event's type, it may be initial subscription, renewal, charging, subscriber or service notification related. Refer to SSM product documentation for a specific event type details.
TableColumnsTooltips.ErrorCode: Related error code in case event denotes a failure. Refer to SSM product documentation for a specific error code details.
TableColumnsTooltips.ChannelType:
Channel that is triggering the event. Possible channels are:
  • IVR
  • USSD
  • SMS
  • WEB
  • CC: Customer Care
  • PROV: Operator Provisioning System
  • TP: Third-Party
  • MOA: Mobile Application
  • OTHER
TableColumnsTooltips.State: Subscription's state. Possible states are: PENDING, ACTIVE, SUSPENDED, INACTIVE.
TableColumnsTooltips.InactivationReason:
Subscription\'s inactivation reason. Field is only available and meaningful for inactive subscriptions. Possible inactivation reasons are:
  • InactivatedBySubscriber: Inactivation requested by the Subscriber from Customer Care or a Self-Care channel.
  • MaxFailedChargingAttemptCountExceeded: Inactivated by the System because max charging attempt count (# of free charging periods) reached.
  • SubscriptionDurationEnded: Inactivated by the System because Subscription end date is reached.
  • InsufficientCredit: Inactivated by the system because Subscriber didn\'t have enough credit for renewal.
  • RenewalNotConfirmed: Inactivated by the System because Subscriber didn\'t confirm subscription renewal.
  • SubscriberInBlackList: Subscriber is in black list.
  • SubscriberNotActive: Subscriber is not in active state.
  • SubscriberNotEligible: Subscriber is not eligible.
TableColumnsTooltips.SubscriberNotificationType: Type of the Subscriber notification. Refer to SSM product documentation for a specific subscriber notification type.

TableColumnsTooltips.Time: Date and time of the event.
TableColumnsTooltips.RestResourceOperation:
Type of the Screening Operation. Possible values are:
  • ADD_TO_WHITE_LIST: Add a new MSISDN to Whitelist.
  • ADD_TO_BLACK_LIST: Add a new MSISDN to Blacklist.
  • DELETE_FROM_WHITE_LIST: Delete an existing MSISDN from Whitelist.
  • DELETE_FROM_BLACK_LIST: Delete an existing MSISDN from Blacklist.
  • GET_ALLOWANCE: Query the Screening status of an MSISDN within a Service Scope.
TableColumnsTooltips.RequestStatus: Screening Operation result as SUCCESS or FAIL.
TableColumnsTooltips.ErrorCode:
Related error code in case event denotes a failure. Possible values are:
  • 3001: AUTHORIZATIONFAILED.
  • 3011: API NOT SUPPORTED.
  • 3021: STORAGE ERROR.
  • 3031: QUOTA ERROR.
  • 3041: WRONG REQUEST.
  • 3051: SERVICE NOT FOUND.
  • 3061: SCOPE NOT FOUND.
TableColumnsTooltips.Channel: Channel that is triggering the screening provisioning/configuration event
TableColumnsTooltips.Allowed: Result of the service subscription screening check,  Allowed (TRUE) vs. Screened (FALSE).

ScreenableEntryId.Label: Phone Number
ScreenableEntryId.Tooltip: Local phone numbers can be added with only 8 digits, "OperatorCode + DirectoryNumber". International phone numbers must be added in international format only with "CountryCode + OperatorCode + DirectoryNumber", e.g. 966567654321. Prefixed phone numbers must be added in international format, e.g. 62*.
